text: The tomb in 1921. Operation Shah Euphrates () was an operation by the Turkish military to relocate the tomb of Suleyman Shah in Syria conducted on 21/22 February 2015. The tomb, which was positioned inside Turkey's only foreign enclave, had been surrounded by self proclaimed Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) forces for over 4 months. On the night of 21–22 February 2015, a Turkish military convoy including tanks and other armored vehicles numbering about 100 entered Syria to evacuate the tomb's 40 guards and relocate the remains. One soldier died during the operation. The tomb complex was destroyed to prevent its use by ISIS. The tomb is now located in Turkish-controlled territory 200 meters inside Syria, 22 km (14 mi) west of Ayn al-Arab and 5 km (3.1 mi) east of the Euphrates, less than 2 km (1.2 mi) southeast of the Turkish village of Esmesi (Esmeler or Esme or Eshme) that is in southernmost Birecik District. Prime Minister of Turkey at the time, Ahmet Davutoglu said that later a new tomb will be constructed in Syrian territory. ==References== Category:2015 in Syria Category:Birecik District Category:Cross-border operations of Turkey Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2015 Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Turkey Category:2015 in Turkey Category:Syria–Turkey relations
title: Operation Shah Euphrates
